attributes.action: let motorbikes in all bus lanes across London at all times.
attributes.additional_details:
catford gyratory: buses and cycles go straight motorbikes go all the way round.
Bromley: buses and cycles turn right into the lower high street motorbikes have to ride straight on turn right and ride all the way back up
Some Thames bridges do not let bikes in the bus lanes.
attributes.background:
different bus lanes operate different rules for motorbikes. sometimes buses and cycles can take a short route into a area whereas cars and motorbikes have to ride all the way round to control traffic levels however motorbikes do not create traffic.
the different rules are pointless and confusing.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Local roads in London are the responsibility of local councils and Transport for London. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors



Transport for London is accountable to the London Assembly, which has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
